item.title: The Time I Have Left demo now available, Kickstarter campaign launched
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/the-time-i-have-left-demo-now-available-kickstarter-campaign-launched

  • PC

A time-driven escape adventure with RPG elements.

A demo for The Time I Have Left, a time-driven escape adventure with RPG elements, is now available for PC via Steam, developer GROUND Game Atelier announced. A Kickstarter campaign seeking €50,000 in funding has also launched, with to be announced stretch goals for console versions.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

In six hours, you will be dead.

Left as the seemingly sole inhabitant of the enormous underground city of Colony 7, Aline is suddenly marked for death by a mysterious phenomenon known as “The Miasma.”

Key Features

The Time I Have Left is a time-driven exploration game with a narrative focus.

  • Guide Aline in a race against the clock through Colony 7, an enormous and eerily deserted underground complex.
  • Face disturbing visions of death in a dynamic turn-based combat system.
  • Preserve your willpower and uncover the hidden truth behind Colony 7, Aline, and The Miasma.

Explore

  • Stunning Visuals – Experience the dense environments of Colony 7, all rendered in a striking style.
  • Nostalgic Flair, Modern Spin – Find clues, solve environmental puzzles, unlock hidden areas, and secure your escape!

Uncover

  • Time-Driven Gameplay – The clock is always ticking, and some events only trigger at specific times. What will you do with the time you have left?
  • Knowledge is Power New abilities are unlocked as you uncover clues and complete the in-game database.
  • Deep, Dark Secrets – Use the information you gather to unlock shortcuts, hidden stories, unique items, and secrets! You may not discover them all in a single playthrough.

Escape

  • Resist the Visions of Death – Aline faces grotesque creatures in her Near-Death Experiences. Since they cannot be harmed, your only options are to resist or flee.
  • Reactive Turn-Based Mechanics – Time your movements well to evade directional attacks. Master your foes’ patterns to escape unharmed!
  • Adventure with an RPG Twist – Experience unique exploration gameplay combined with a fresh take on the classic JRPG formula.

Watch a new trailer below.

“Near-Death Experience” Trailer

item.title: Turnip Boy studio Snoozy Kazoo announces fast-paced 3D platformer Hobnobbers for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/turnip-boy-studio-snoozy-kazoo-announces-fast-paced-3d-platformer-hobnobbers-for-pc

  • PC

Worship a divorcee Lady Goddess.

Turnip Boy Commits Tax Evasion and Turnip Boy Robs a Bank developer Snoozy Kazoo has announced Hobnobbers, a fast-paced 3D platformer coming to PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Hobnobbers is a fast-paced 3D platformer where you and your crew of mischievous gnomish critters storm through multi-dimensional outlets and fight Pixys who seek to harvest you for yummy snacks. Raid the shops and stuff shinys in your hat before the portal closes, or risk being stranded in a whimsical capitalist hellscape. Deliver your loot to Lady Goddess, an enigmatic figure trying to get revenge on her ex-husband. Trade the items you recover for cosmetic upgrades—a.k.a. drip—or, if you fail, get turned into stew!

Key Features

  • Lady Goddess Needs Shinys – You are a Hobnobber who was graciously given sentience by the Lady Goddess. In exchange for this gracious gift you must do her bidding and steal shinys.
  • Pillage From Lord Pixy – Tiger rugs. Sodi pop. Christmas trees. All of these shinys and more can be found in Lord Pixy’s domain. Team up with your friends and comb that place to the nines!
  • Fight Pixy Minions – It seems that the person you’re pillaging from isn’t pleased about it. Who’d have guessed? Dodge or kill his minion Pixys and survive the Hexes cast upon you. Can you survive long enough to take the Beetle ride home with all your shinys?
  • Sacrifice Your Shinys – Sentience comes with a price and that price is eternal servitude. Can’t get her enough shinys? You do not need sentience anymore and will be thrown into the stew.
  • Get Epic New Drip – Rejoice! Your relationship is transactional! For treats and shinys you will get awesome drip. Be a clown, wizard, or if you’re feeling saucy—show off your bare-feathered crow-like body! So long as you can flex this on others, life is beautiful and fulfilling!

A Game Containing the Following:

  • A whimsical mall to loot!
  • Evil pixys to kill and be killed by!
  • Up to eight-player online cooperative play.
  • In-game cosmetics!
  • Rats!
  • A lady goddess you can impress!
  • The ability to be thrown into the stew by said lady goddess!

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Nubs! launches in Q2 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/nubs-launches-in-q2-2025

  • PC

New gameplay trailer released.

Chaotic multiplayer arena brawler Nubs! will launch for PC via Steam in Q2 2025, developers Rangatang and Glowfish announced. A beta test will run from December 14 to 15.

Here is an overview of the game, via Rangatang and Glowfish:

About

All hail Konzumos the Unentertained, the one who demands to be amused. Guide your Nub through a variety of treacherous arenas brimming with traps. Unlock new power-ups after every match, and collect the most ridiculous gear to smack other Nubs down—all to become Konzumos’ favorite.

Nubs! is an absurd player-versus-player arena brawler inspired by old-school, top-down RPGs. It’s brought to you with passion and care by numerous creators of Awesomenauts and Trifox.

Gather your friends and clash in lightning-quick multiplayer battles that mix frantic, party-style chaos with roguelite progression.

Sharpen your wits (Nub-style) and battle against the other Nubs in various game modes as you dodge booby traps and lethally fling fish alike! With simple rules in a mad world, every match can spiral into all-out pandemonium at any moment!

Key Features

  • Online or Local Carnage – Play together with up to four friends or foes in the living room or across the globe and put your skills to the test in the arena. Will you be the last Nub standing?
  • Frenzied Brawler Action – Fight for victory in an assortment of multi-levelled arenas, keep a keen eye for traps that could make or break your path to victory in this fast-paced indie game.
  • No Nub Alike – With their own oddball style, these tiny troublemakers are funny, silly, and absolutely ready to throw down! As cute as they may look, they arm themselves with ridiculous pick ups to gain a tactical advantage.
  • Modes for Days – Stay on your toes with a variety of game modes and a roguelite progression system that ensures no two play sessions are the same. Dive in and see what surprises await!

Watch the announcement trailer below.

The MIX Fall Showcase 2024 Trailer

item.title: Kathy Rain 2: Soothsayer announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/kathy-rain-2-soothsayer-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Demo out now for point-and-click adventure game sequel.

Publisher Raw Fury and developer Clifftop Games have announced Kathy Rain 2: Soothsayer, the second installment in the point-and-click Kathy Rain series. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date was not announced. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Your favorite smart-mouthed, kick-ass detective is back, and she’s in for a wild ride!

In this point-and-click urban thriller, down-and-out private eye Kathy Rain will embark on her most dangerous case yet—the pursuit of the notorious serial killer known as the Soothsayer. Find clues, gather evidence, connect the dots, and confront the murderer before the hunter becomes the hunted…

Story

When this story begins, things are looking dire for private eye Kathy Rain. It’s the year 1998, and she is utterly broke: The Katmobile is running on fumes, the fridge is nearly empty, and an eviction is looming close.

However, opportunity arrives when a big cash reward is announced for solving the “Soothsayer” case—a string of serial murders with a death grip on the metropolitan city of Kassidy.

With great reward comes great risk—will this be the case that defines Kathy’s career, or will she become the next victim of the Soothsayer?

Key Features

  • Point-and-Click Urban Thriller – Take on the second case with Kathy Rain in an all-new adventure that is as hard-hitting as emotional. Fit for newcomers and fans of the series alike!
  • Improved Graphics – See Kathy Rain as never before with a higher resolution pixel art style that compliments Kathy’s gritty world, alongside modern features such as dynamic lighting and surface reflections.
  • Stunning Cinematic Sequences – Watch the story unfold with beautiful hand-drawn cutscenes and character portraits.
  • Bigger Than Ever – Play through the longest Clifftop title yet with a deep narrative that spans many diverse locations and a wide range of characters.
  • Familiar Voices – Arielle Siegel returns as Kathy Rain, alongside other familiar voices in supportive roles!
  • Make a Note – Log interesting findings in Kathy’s notebook and refer to them in your investigation. Connect narrative threads for surprising and satisfying outcomes.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero details Skullrock Island facilities, phantoms
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/phantom-brave-the-lost-hero-details-skullrock-island-facilities-phantoms

Get the details below.

■ New Illustration by Takehito Harada

■ Postludes Character Cameos

After you complete the main story of Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero, five characters from popular Nippon Ichi Software, Inc. titles will appear in the postgame content, Postludes! Characters include Laharl, Valvatorez, and Pirilika from the Disgaea series, along with Priere from La Pucelle Tactics, Cornet from Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure, and the ever-popular Asagi!

Each character is rendered adorably in the Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero 3D style. Players can look forward to seeing how these characters from completely different universes become intertwined in Marona and her friends’ wild adventures!

In addition to the Postludes, players will have the opportunity to enjoy characters from even more popular Nippon Ichi Software titles in the world of Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero as downloadable content.

Characters include Scarlet, Sprout, Castile, and Walnut from the original Phantom Brave, Kotomo from Yomawari: Night Alone, The Liar Princes from The Liar Princess and the Blind Prince, and Mad Rat & Heart from MAD RAT DEAD. In addition, Samayoi, the Wanderer from the Japan-exclusive BAR Stella Abyss, will also be available as downloadable content!

■ Enjoy the Limitless Fun of Skullrock Island

On Marona and her companions’ base, Skullrock Island, your allies can manage the various Facilities to provide services. To unlock a new Facility, simply create a unit of the required class. These Facilities offer a range of benefits, such as a Shop where you can purchase items, and a Juice Bar, which allows you to distribute EXP amongst your allies.

Additional Facilities allow you to strengthen your units even further, such as Dungeon Creation, Fusion, Awakening / Reincarnation, Titles, and more, offering near-limitless opportunities for enjoyment! For in-depth information on the various Facilities and what benefits they provide, please refer to the media kit below.

■ Introducing the Facilities of Skullrock Island

Marina – Necessary Character: Apricot

By strengthening your pirate ship, you are able to increase your entire party’s stats.

Depending on the pirate ship you choose, your boosted stats will change. Ships can do things like increasing the amount of EXP gained to help you level up or increasing movement and jump ability for maps with large height differences. Try choosing the best ship for your current situation!

Skills – Necessary Unit: Fighter or Striker

—You can learn Skills by clearing the conditions necessary to obtain Skills and Abilities and selecting them on the “Learn Skill” screen.

Skills are actions that can be used in combat, such as attacks, healing, or buffs. There are Skills that deal a massive amount of damage to a single enemy, Skills that damage several enemies in a wide range at once, Skills that can heal multiple allies, and more. Carefully choosing your Skills can change the tide of battle!

Abilities are tied to a unit’s class or race and have various effects such as increasing their stats, pushing enemies off the map, decreasing damage sustained, strengthening Gadgets, increasing the range of attacks, and much, much more. Take your time and enjoy searching for just the right combination of Abilities to take on battles with ease!

However, there’s a limit to how many you can learn, so sometimes it may be necessary to forget previously-learned Skills and Abilities. Once a Skill has been learned, it can be forgotten with the “Skill Order” command. Skills that have been forgotten can be re-learned at any time.

Fusion

You can strengthen an item by synthesizing it with Mana and materials. When you get a new weapon and find that you no longer need the weapon you had been using, use Fusion. The new weapon’s HP and other stats will be increased, and you will be able to use this powered-up version in battle.

You can also convert items into Mana to obtain the item’s Title!

—Synthesize your unused items to make the strongest weapons!

Titles – Necessary Unit: Old Man

Titles are transferable labels that affect a unit’s status. Each unit or item possesses a Title from the beginning, and each Title has different effects. You can equip Titles however you desire, so if you obtain an item with a powerful Title, be sure to try transferring it to something else!

—Affix powerful Titles for various, powerful stat boosts!

Titles can also be equipped to dungeons you’ve created. Affix a Title to a dungeon and every floor of the dungeon you clear will increase that Title’s stats! Defeat random dungeons to strengthen Titles and use them to improve your units and items!

—When you give a dungeon a Title, all monsters in that dungeon will also receive that Title. Be sure you’re ready for some difficult battles before you decide to equip a powerful Title!

Juice Bar – Necessary Unit: Chef

Using the Juice Bar, you can redistribute accumulated experience to different characters. The more you increase the level of the Juice Bar, the more experience you will be able to accumulate.

By making use of the Juice Bar, you can raise the level of a newly-created ally in an instant or level up a Reincarnated ally from Level 1. It’s an extremely useful tool for powering up your characters!

—If you increase the ratio of EXP stored at the Juice Bar to over 100%, characters that you deploy in battle will receive 0 EXP, but the amount of EXP that will go to the Juice Bar will be over 100%! Talk about a deal!

Awaken / Reincarnate – Necessary Unit: Marona

By using Awaken / Reincarnate, you can change a unit’s class or increase the Spirit (stat bonus).

Awakening is a unit-strengthening feature that allows you to keep a unit’s current level and receive the corresponding amount of Spirit.

It’s a great way to keep the same class, race, and level while still powering that unit up.

—Use Spirit to add stat bonuses and strengthen your units!

Reincarnation is a system where a character’s class or race can change and they are reset to Level 1 while retaining their Skills, Abilities, and Title.

When Reincarnating, you will receive that character’s current level worth of Spirit, which you can then distribute to their stats, so they will be much more powerful than a normal Level 1 unit. In addition, since they will keep the Skills and Abilities of their former class or race, they will be a very unique unit.

To use either Awakening or Reincarnation, very important items called “Changebooks” and “Eggs” are required, respectively.

—A Fighter who has Reincarnated into a Witch retains the Fighter’s Wild Cry Ability.

You can overcome class restrictions by repeatedly Reincarnating to raise units that possess your ideal Abilities!

Create Dungeons – Necessary Unit: Explorer

By creating random dungeons and completing them, you can level up your units, find items, and strengthen Titles. Dungeons are created by using a Map. The Map’s name will determine the dungeon’s location, enemies, stats, and obtainable items.

When creating a random dungeon, you can freely choose its Title and, when you clear the dungeon, you will receive the Title you created as a reward.

Be sure to level up all the Titles you create!

—When you create a dungeon, you’ll receive the name you set as a Title upon clearing it. Try making up your own, original Titles!

—As you progress through a dungeon’s floors, the enemies’ levels will increase, which in turn strengthens the Title of the dungeon. In addition, the chance that rare items will appear also increases.

In addition, there are floor bonuses that allow you to obtain more EXP. Also, every 10th floor, an event might occur where you will encounter a Gadget that only appears in dungeons, the Slot Machine.

This gives you the chance to earn more EXP, Mana, or BOR. If you’re lucky, you might get a rare item, but if you’re unlucky, something horrible might happen. Still, it’s a great chance to strike it rich and power up!

—However, if you are defeated in a dungeon, you will lose all obtained items and EXP. As you advance, enemies will get stronger and stronger. Be sure to exit the dungeon when you can, or proceed with the utmost caution!

—Aside from completely clearing every floor, you are only able to exit a dungeon every 10 floors by using the exit or at any time using the Explorer’s special command, Return. It is also possible to create a temporary save in the random dungeons. To resume, just select “Continue” from the Title Screen.

Salvage – Necessary Unit: Angler

Automatically obtain the treasure hidden in a given nautical region by dispatching Salvage groups. The time needed to complete, and the items received, will change depending on the location and the approach taken by the dispatched Salvage crew.

Your crew will search for items automatically as time passes, no matter whether you clear a stage or progress the story, so be sure to send those groups out! What a convenient service!

—The items found change depending on the Angler’s level! The amount of time needed to find items will decrease as you power up the Salvage group with BOR (currency).

Gadgets – Necessary Unit: Engineer

Create and power up Gadgets to summon on the battlefield!

Use Gadgets you’ve created to destroy blocks, bring items to you, and perform special actions in battle, providing many different ways to tackle each map!

■ Introducing Some of the Phantoms

A total of 51 phantom units will appear in the game, from nostalgic classes to those with new outfits, and entirely new classes making their debut. Here is a look at some of the unique classes that appear in the game:

Striker

Frontline fighters with high physical defense that use spears. Possess the unique ability to increase their attack power by moving, making them a great choice for a mobile fighter. Have high physical defense, but low magical defense, so be careful!

Wizard

Has a broader AOE range than the similar magic class, the Witch, so they can attack more enemies from the backlines. Just like the Witch, they have low physical defense and are not very mobile, but if you account for that, they are a class you can rely on to take care of multiple foes.

Healer

Not only does this class possess healing abilities, but they also increase the defense of all allies in range, so they can fulfill their role simply by being deployed as a backline healer. Necessary for the Heal Facility, so having at least one will make your adventure easier.

Engineer

A unique class that allows you to use Gadget-related abilities such as building up more Mana. Their real value is revealed when there are Gadgets on the map. Deploy them with Apricot to witness their true power!

Old Man

Can use any close-range weapon well and is a powerful frontline fighter. Though he has some peculiar abilities, his high attack and defense make him very useful in battle. However, he will be Removed after only 2 turns, so he is best used when you need a burst of power.

Granny

The most powerful backline humanoid magic class. Has high INT and magical defense, which affects magic casting, and high RES, which affects healing. Can also obtain abilities that increase the AOE and range of Skills. However, like the Old Man, she will be Removed after only two turns, so your timing is very important.

Sailor

A peculiar mid-range unit that doesn’t have any special abilities or specialities, but instead has the most turns before being Removed. Their abilities make them the target of attacks, so they’re useful for shielding weaker allies. Train this class to get many abilities such as an ability to increase their Remove turns, get more EXP, decrease SP usage, and other unique skills. Maybe it would be worthwhile to raise one as a training exercise!?

Goat Fighter

An exceptional warrior of the Goat tribe with the ability to blow back their enemies. Their attack power increases as they move, and their other abilities increase with additional Goat tribe units on the map, making them an easy class to power up. However, they are extremely weak to magic, so be careful!

Mer Guard

A Mer tribe warrior with strong defenses who can protect their allies. Can reliably protect allies with their Mer tribe characteristics of being immune to status ailments and having high magic defense. Abilities increase with other Mer tribe units on the map.

Owl Gunner

An Owl tribe class that uses guns and has high JUMP power. Abilities increase with other Owl tribe units on the map. Can toy with enemies by taking potshots at them from high vantage points while avoiding damage.
